messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:22): hsivonen: no, nobody seems willing to make that kind of claim on record :-(
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (22:30): all right, this is probably a FAQ, but what's up with accesskey?
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (22:31): it's mentioned repeatedly in wf2 but not at all in html5
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:34): haven't yet worked out wtf to do with it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:35): it's so fundamentally broken in so many ways...
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (22:35): documenting current practice isn't sufficient?
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (22:35): i understand the extent of its brokenness
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:36): currnet practice varies dramatically and is fundamentally broken
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (22:36): that has never stopped you before...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:38): 6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f: the difference is that for accesskey i don't know how to fix it :-(
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (22:44): http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms535181.aspx
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (22:44): "This example uses the address element to italicize text."
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (22:44): just shoot me
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (22:57): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#area does not define the nohref attribute
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:57): what does the nohref attribute do?
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (22:57): described here: http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/struct/objects.html#adef-nohref
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:58): but what does the nohref attribute do?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:58): (there are few UA conformance requirements in the HTML4 spec, and none for nohref, so it's not a good source of information for what things in HTML do)
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (22:59): i understand
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (23:00): i believe it's a way of marking that the <area>'s lack of an @href attribute is intentional
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:00): so it does nothing?
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (23:00): i.e. for validation
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (23:00): checking firefox code
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (23:01): hang on
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:01): (and if we can't trust that the lack of an href attribute is intentional, why can we trust that the presence of a nohref attribute _is_?)
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (23:02): firefox does precisely nothing with it
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (23:02): no changes in behavior, nothing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:02): ok then
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (23:02): http://msdn.microsoft.com/workshop/author/dhtml/reference/properties/nohref.asp says "Sets or retrieves whether clicks in this region cause action."
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (23:02): which is slightly tantalizing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:02): msdn is wrong. :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:03): i tested it a lot, couldn't find that the attribute did anything, so i dropped it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:03): it seemed singularily pointless.
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (23:03): http://www.idocs.com/tags/images/_AREA_NOHREF.html
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (23:03): it is for dead zones in shaped <area>s
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (23:04): see the idocs link
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:06): yes but how does that differ from the lack of an href attribute?
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (23:08): hacking the idocs test case reveals that there is no difference
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (23:08): i have discovered html's most useless attribute
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:08): pretty much
6579a25fc8e60d2ff7dfb590bb79042f (23:08): or, more likely, rediscovered

c3b830f9a769b49d3250795223caad4d (23:26): hi all...offering some experience re: 512 scanning for encoding.  GRDDL parsing seems to be depending on profile for each microformat...and if one defines each official and draft uF, 512 is rapidly approached.  might be something to work out with the GRDDL/hGRDDL WG folks
c3b830f9a769b49d3250795223caad4d (23:27): 2nd concern: if multiple media and/or alternate stylesheet PI's are used, 512 can become a concern, too
